net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller

Interface ProxyUnmarshaller<D extends DocumentProxy>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CopyingProxyUnmarshaller<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JAXBCounterExampleMarshaller, JAXBMarshaller, JAXBModuleMarshaller, JAXBProductDESMarshaller, ProductDESToModuleUnmarshaller, ValidUnmarshaller

    public interface ProxyUnmarshaller<D extends DocumentProxy>

    The basic unmarshaller interface.

    The ProxyUnmarshaller provides the basic means for the DocumentManager to unmarshal, i.e., load documents from various file formats.

    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDefaultExtension()
      Gets a default extension for the files read by this unmarshaller.
      Class<D> getDocumentClass()
      Gets the class of documents handled by this unmarshaller.
      DocumentManager getDocumentManager()
      Gets the document manager used by this unmarshaller to resolve references to other files.
      Collection<String> getSupportedExtensions()
      Gets a list of file name extensions for files that may be handled by this marshaller.
      Collection<FileFilter> getSupportedFileFilters()
      Gets a list of file filters that may be handled by this marshaller.
      void setDocumentManager(DocumentManager manager)
      Sets a document manager to used by this unmarshaller to resolve references to other files.
      D unmarshal(URI uri)
      Loads a document from a file.

    • Method Detail

      • unmarshal

        D unmarshal(URI uri)
     throws WatersUnmarshalException,
            IOException
        Loads a document from a file.
        Parameters:
        uri - A URI specifying the location of the document to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The loaded document.
        Throws:
        WatersUnmarshalException - to indicate that parsing the input file has failed for some reason.
        IOException - to indicate that the input file could not be opened or read.
